snippet: The Tennessee Valley Authority planned to close a total of eight electricity-generating units at three plants in Alabama and Kentucky, significantly cutting the emissions of greenhouse gases.
abstract: Tennessee Valley Authority sharply accelerates shift away from coal as an energy source, saying it will shut down eight electricity-generating units that together will burn nearly a fifth of its coal in 2013; closings are part of long-term strategy for authority to generate 20 percent of its electricity from coal, down from current 38 percent.
lead_paragraph: The Tennessee Valley Authority planned to close a total of eight electricity-generating units at three plants in Alabama and Kentucky, significantly cutting the emissions of greenhouse gases.

headline.main: A Push Away From Burning Coal as an Energy Source
headline.print_headline: T.V.A. Speeds Push Away From the Burning of Coal
